name: Breezes Resort & Spa Bahamas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: myself and boyfriend went to breezes on october 13th - 23rd we had an amazing time couldnt have asked for more, please do not listen to the petty reviews on here about the paint work etc...we found the rooms more than adequate for the purpose they serve...food was amazing especially the 2 resturants.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: The bar staff were excellent never had to wait for a drink once they were constantly on hand to serve you. The entertainments staff again were excellent the night time shows some were hillarious, everyone we met was more than friendly...i think this hotel should be a 5 * not 4* i would defo recomend the breezes brand to anyone thinking of a holiday to the carribean.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our Stay
Breezes Blows
reviews.text: its defo a party resort everyones up for drinks and a good time!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also met some amazing people from all walks of life, Tony & Lindy, Mike & Tammy, Simon & Sarah + the batchelors.....Goodbye my lover :) hahahah
reviews.title: Nice staff - hotel needs major overhaul

reviews.text: loved it!!!!
reviews.title: We survived Sandy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to the Breezes resort in the Bahamas for our honeymoon Jan 6-11, 2008. After reading some of the reviews I was VERY concerned about staying there. Needless to say I was worried for no reason. The room was wonderful!! Very clean (not a roach to be found anywhere) and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The only rude people we had the misfortune of encountering were some of the younger college guests that thought the world revolved around them.
reviews.title: Breezes was great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food in the dining hall was good although after 3 consecutive days you needed a break from it. We dined at the Garden of Eden restaurant one night and the food there was EXCELLENT! Reservations do need to be made the day before. The evening entertainment provided was excellent! The staff were true entertainers!
reviews.title: Nice vacation

reviews.text: the only disappointment that I experienced was the internet. I was led to believe from an operator at the 800# that the internet would be available in my room or I could use the "Internet Cafe". This was not the case. You need to purchase time ($18 for 1hr) and no way to print..nor could you bring a flash stick to email pictures home.
reviews.title: What a Great Trip, Will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, I would recommend this resort and look forward to going back.
reviews.title: Loved Breezes like my second home

likes.liked: — The over-all friendliness of the entire staff--they made you feel like you were home
likes.disliked: — no ice/refridgerators for the room--that would have been nice

reviews.title: I loved the Breezes Hotel
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed 5 nights at Breezes last week and both agree it was a great vacation. This was our 3rd time staying at an all-inclusive hotel and my husband liked this trip the best. This was the least expensive AI resort that we have been to and we both felt that it was the best value. We took advantage of one of the $99/night per person offers that Super Clubs occasionally has so I personally did not go with very high expectations given that one can easily spend over $200/night just for accomodations in the Bahamas. Our room was clean and larger than we expected although one frustrating aspect was that we were between adjoining rooms and noise and smells drifted through the doors. The sliding and exterior doors both also lacked good sound protection so we heard music playing until around midnight some nights and doors slamming throughout the evening. However, I should note that my husband often has to wear ear plugs to sleep in our quiet suburban home and yet he slept fine here without his earplugs so the noise must have been tolerable.

I was very excited to be doing a long weekend getaway with 2 girlfriends in celebration of our 40th birthdays. This trip was quite a comedy of errors as we experienced one issue after another with this resort...and while none of them ruined the trip, the place was definitely not nice enough to warrant a return stay.
reviews.title: Won't go back any time soon

likes.liked: — The beach was beautiful and the Straw Market in Nassau was fun.
likes.disliked: — Rooms (particularly the non-renovated ones) were bad to nothing special...food was mostly disappointing...lack of attention to details.

reviews.text: When we arrived on Friday and checked into our room (156), it was clearly under construction. A 2x4 framed the closet (on which the door was missing) and the bathroom counter was cracked, with a portion missing where they had inserted the new toilet. It also smelled terribly musty and the decor was nonexistent. When we asked about moving rooms, we were told that the hotel was completely booked and to try back first thing in the morning. We asked again about an hour later and a room was found on the renovated side.
reviews.title: Fantastic Getaway

reviews.text: Our new room (307) was much better with a brand new bathroom, carpeting, and a flat screen TV. However, we soon discovered that the phone didn’t work and the TV didn’t have a remote and wouldn't change channels. Also, we had no towels or trash bucket (though this was quickly remedied). A new remote was brought but didn’t work correctly. The staff member who brought the remote (at 10:30 pm after a second request) checked the phone but said he didn’t really know anything about it.
reviews.title: Breezes is Fabulous and Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The following day, we made another request to have our phone and remote be fixed (again to no avail). We made dinner reservations for the following night in the Garden of Eden restaurant (though we were never given the reservation form).
reviews.title: Loved Breezes Bahamas Entertainment crew is the best!
Sure not a "Super" Club
reviews.text: On our third day, we again went to the desk to request our phone and remote be fixed (and once again, it never happened). Upon returning to our room to get ready for our 6:30 dinner reservation, we also found that our room hadn’t been cleaned nor our towels replenished. We called to request clean towels, but they never came and, worse, we discovered that there was no hot water.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located on Cable Beach with beautiful wide sandy beaches, this resort is located in an ideal spot. The staff goes out of their way to help you, the resort is spotless and our room was large and spacious. We actually ended up there by accident--Hurricane Sandy prevented us from getting to our original location on another island.The staff couldn't have been more accommodating. We were wholeheartedly welcomed, given a partial ocean view room, and told to "go get a drink and sit by the pool while we get your room ready". We were unfamiliar with an all inclusive, so it was all a new experience for us. We were very pleased. There were several bars on the premises, always a place to get something to eat, nightly shows appealing to a wide range of people, and the most beautiful beach with soft white sand. Because we came in on the tail end of a hurricane, water sports were not an option until the day we left, but the do offer quite a variety. Right outside the door you can catch a bus to take you to the straw market and main shopping area of Nassau, and the tour desk offers many optional tours. We had a great time and wo ldn'd hesitate to go back.
reviews.title: Great All Inclusive Resort on the best beach on the island

reviews.text: Stayed a week at Breezes. Loved the staff! Good alternative for young couple with less funds. Unfortunately, I had Sandals in Jamaica to compare it to as another all-inclusive beach resort. After upgrading twice, we ended up with a decent room, ocean & pool view, but no balcony! Why aren't there any balconies? The rooms are bare bones, and the amenities are outdated. The shower spray was incredibly weak, the mattress was a bit uncomfortable, and we had to slam our door to get it to close. The outlets in the wall were loose, seemed somewhat dangerous and located in awkward places. Glad we brought extension cords! The furniture needed updating and the drawers would end up on the floor if you weren't careful in pulling them out. The thermostat was difficult to adjust to a comfortable temperature, and at night, I suppose like a lot of places, the air barely kicked on. The food in the main dining hall was average considering it was mass produced. Enjoyed the restaurants on site, and the grill food outside was a treat. And I just can't say enough good about the staff ... friendly, personable, accommodating, polite, and welcoming.
reviews.title: Great staff!

reviews.text: My hubby and I stayed at Breezes in January 2012 for the second time in two years. This time around we brought my Mother in law with us as a special treat for her. Like last time the stay was enjoyable mostly due to the staff being so friendly. Some of the more notable staff members were KJ, Marvin and Arthur (from Garden of Eden) and a couple of others (who I unfortunately forget their names now :( ) who were always upbeat and trying to help the guests have a good time. The food was fine for an all inclusive and there was enough to choose from. I really liked how every night in the lobby there are different events going on to entertain their guests (such as Funky D). I have read some of the bad reviews and to be honest I think some people have unrealistic expectations. The hotel could use some updating but it is in good condition. I have travelled quite a bit and would likely go to Breezes again. Its a reasonable value for what you're paying. It's not the Atlantis but then again you're not paying Atlantis prices...it's a clean and fun atmosphere. My only gripe would be that they should get a heated pool....although you're in the Caribbean, the pool water should not feel like ice water. Other than that I would recommend this hotel to friends.
reviews.title: Another great stay at Breezes!

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I went on vacation to breezes and were very happy with our choice. It's very economical and easily accessible. Also, it has tons of things to do at the hotel and off of it. It was so easy to get to downtown to shop and walk around, or get to Atlantis. What we liked most about it was that the place is very laid back and when we wanted hussle and bustle we can go find it but didn't have it all the time and thus could relax. We will be returning.
reviews.title: Relaxing party vacation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bahamas is a great place i have visited before, this time it was for my girlfriends birthday so we booked a 2 week stay at breezes without reading any reviews of the place HOW WRONG WAS THIS, the check in was ok the room comfortable the bed big and fairly comfortable, the fun started the next day as we went to breakfast in the buffet the first food we chose albeit a hot meal was cold, we dissmissed this as just poor timing as the week went on in 2 weeks I never had a hot meal in the not buffet but canteen the noise unbearable the shoddy service the mess all too much this was just the beginng, as we sat by the pool the noise from the unsophisticated YANKS overwhelmed us the thought of BOOT CAMP came rapidly to my mind you were almost forced by the entertainment guys to take part, and by day three I was right, we were leaving the hotel and I use the term hotel very loosley to go use the facilities at the Sheraton hotel about a 1 mile walk away but better suited OUR standards, I can confirm that the breezes resort is by far and I mean FAR the worst place I have ever stayed I have been in better prisons and eventually on our last day demanded our money back BEWARE BE VERY AWARE OF THIS DUMP BECAUSE THATS ALL IT IS HOLIDAY RIUNED BY BREEZES !!! if I was to rate it by stars -10
reviews.title: holiday in hell

reviews.text: Traveled to Breezes with a large group 11/12-16/12 and it was absolutely beautiful. I have travelled many places and have never run into so many amazing, helpful staff as at Breezes. From check-in, to the bellmen, to the waitstaff and barstaff, to the housecleaning staff, to the activity staff-everyone went out of their way to make sure we had a great time. We loved the setup of the hotel. There was something for everyone. Besides the pools and beach, we used the gym, pool tables, ping pong tables, and basketball court. We also did alot of the activities both by the pool/beach during the day and at the shows at night. We loved the shows and felt the staff did an amazing job. It was even more amazing when we realized how many hours they work since they do the activities during the day and perform at night. Everyone was great and I wish I could remember everyone's name. But I do need to make a special shoutout to Philly and Navarro as they were so good with our group, as was everyone. And we loved Funky G(maybe a different initial after Funky, my memory is shot!) singing each night. He got everyone involved and he was so talented.
reviews.title: Perfect days everyday at Breezes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were beautiful and cleaned nicely everyday. We all felt the food was good both at the buffet and the italian restaurant (we didn't make it to the Garden restaurant but it looked so pretty, both inside and out). The food by the pool was good as well. The Conch fritters were a big hit as well as the crab salad.
reviews.title: Breezes Has An Amazing Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area by the lobby where there is a bar, the pool/ping pong tables, etc. and where the shows are at night served as a great gathering spot for our group. People could do whatever activity they wanted but everyone was nearby. It offered alot of options, including just sitting in a nice breeze, and was very comfortable.
reviews.title: The Ease of Travel while staying at Breezes

reviews.text: This is a place I want to return to and so did everyone else in our large group. I am recommending it to my family as a great vacation idea. I could easily see a family reunion type vacation because it is so contained so you would always be near your family but yet there are so many activities that everyone could do their own thing.
reviews.title: "PIP" Perfect, Incredible, Paradise

reviews.text: All in all this is a great resort. And EVERY staff we ran into was friendly and helpful. That is almost impossible. But you felt they cared if you had a good time or not. You can't go wrong here!
reviews.title: My adventure in the Bahamas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at Breezes Bahamas this past August and it was our 4th trip there. We also went in Jan 2007, Aug 2006, and Jan 2006 and we loved every minute of it. The beach, Cable beach, is gorgeous. Breezes definetly has the best strip of beach over all of the other hotels. There are plenty of chairs on the beach and around the pool. The pools are very nice, one has a swim-up bar with stools in the water, one has a volleyball net, and one has lounge chairs in the water so you can stay cool while lounging on a comfortable chair. Also, staying all-inclusive is definetly the way to go. There is a buffet for breakfast, lunch, and dinner in the main dining room, plus they have a snack bar poolside where you can get burgers, chicken, salads, drinks, etc all throughout the day. The buffet spread changes everyday, but you can always get pasta with tomato sauce and salads in case you dont find something you like. You definetly never go hungry. The two restaurants where you need reservations are excellent too and you should definetly not miss them if you stay here. Pastafari is a nice, low-light Italian restaurant with great lobster, pasta, and steak dishes. Garden of Eden is very romantic, with the option to eat inside or outside, and the food there is wonderful too. Both of them have a dress code (no shorts or t-shirts allowed). It was great to get dressed nice and go to a nice restaurant as a change form the buffet. There is always a bar open, and for those of you who like really late night snacks there is the snack attack down in the main dining hall open from 11:00pm-3:00am. The people are always very friendly and attentive and we never had a problem with anyone.
reviews.title: Trip number 4 wonderful Breezes

likes.disliked: — pool cleanliness and no room service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is also a bus that you can catch right outside the hotel that will take you downtown for $2 a person. My boyfriend and I have traveled a lot to other places and have to say that downtown Nassau was the safest place we've been. No one hassals you to buy things or bothers you on the street and there are lots of nice restaurants to get lunch or dinner in. Senior Frogs is nice to visit and the food is good but it's overpriced. We find the Iguana Cafe to be one of our favorite places. You have a great choice of food while listening to live music. And the prices are resonable. We also went out to eat for dinner downtown and felt very safe in a cab at night.
reviews.title: ENJOYED BREEZES

likes.liked: — large comfortable bedding and a great view of the beach
likes.disliked: — The overall look of the room could have more of a caribean ting going on mon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel does not have a casino but the hotel down the road does and it's only a 5 minute walk away. You can even walk down the beach to get to the casino, and it's a beautiful walk, especially at sunset. It's also a great way to see how the other hotels' beaches are all rocky or have a giant cliff between the chairs and the water, while the beach at Breezes is amazing and rock and cliff free.
reviews.title: Had A Great Time at Breezes!

likes.liked: — The Staff!!! They were all so Nice!!!
likes.disliked: — Balcony door didn't open. This isn't about the hotel per se, but the water down there taste horrible. Definitely need bottled water!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very fun, comfortable, laid-back hotel. The open-air lobby gives a great caribbean feel. If you are looking for a really ritzy place where everyone in the lobby talks in a whisper and there is piano music playing, this is not the place for you. But if you are looking for a fun, laid-back caribbean vacation, Breezes Bahamas is definetly the place to go. I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Average Hotel, Average Food, Great Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from this resort less then 24hrs ago!!!!
reviews.title: A little better than last year

reviews.text: Th resort itself is beautiful, the water is gorgeous, and the weather was great the entire time we were there. The food was really good, if you're used to resort food.
reviews.title: Amazing!
BREEZES IS THE BEST!
reviews.text: The best part of the stay, however, was the staff. They were welcoming, fun, friendly and always around. They had some extremely talented dancers on the animation team; Bullet and KJ. The shows and club were way out of the league of any other resort I've stayed in because of them. All the animation team was great, and there was always something to do.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definately go back!
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights and it was great. The food could in the main dining was similar everyday, thought they'd have more seafood being it's the Bahamas. But it was good. They have great entainment and would definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Loved the Bahamas, didn't love Breezes

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week last summer and did not know what to expect because of some of the negative reviews. We were blown away! The resort itself is a little dated in some aspects but you really get the carribean feel from the decor and all the bright colors. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The buffet food is ok but the pool grill and the Garden of Eden were great. There are tons of activities and the beach is amazing. We are going back again next summer with friends. I would definitely recommend staying here but try to avoid spring break unless you are looking for a party type atmosphere.
reviews.title: I LOVE THIS PLACE

reviews.text: its right you get what you pay for the hotel does look quite tierd in some areas, but the amount you pay per night for the food etc you get its pretty good.
reviews.title: Good with Friends not a Romantic destination

reviews.text: ive been here twice with friends, and the staff are wonderful including all the kitchen staff and chefs they CANT do enough for you and for that reason id go back agin if the chance came up.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for!!!!

reviews.text: there is always alot of meat, fish and pizza and fries and there is a constant buffet literally all night for some of the greedy americains.
reviews.title: Couldn't ask for a better stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: pools could be cleaner but we use to only go in the sea!!
reviews.title: A great value

reviews.text: I stayed at Breezes from October 22, 2012 – November 1, 2012 with my three best friends. I prefer to travel to the Caribbean and Mexico and being a timeshare owner I have been able to stay at some of the best resorts. I had read a lot of reviews before arriving so I really didn’t know what to expect. But we are an open minded group of women. The check in process was easy and our rooms were ready. We were greeted with lemonade by some of the entertainment staff. I did inform the staff at check in that I needed a plush bed so they accommodated me with a duvet cover. Of course I had to have two. I have to admit I’m a little extra. The rooms are nice and clean. The pictures on the website show you what you are going to get. All rooms have flat screen TV and the reception was good. But of course I didn’t come to the Bahamas to watch TV. The bathrooms are really nice.
reviews.title: Another Great Breezes Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Read some poor reviews on this place so was a little concerned. First off, this isn't Atlantis. Atlantis is very much like the Bellagio in Vegas, only on a beach. Crazy fancy, huge, and sterile. If that is your idea of a carribean getaway, go for it.
reviews.title: Just what we needed

reviews.text: Breezes is a nice little resort for the price. I would however warn you against the spring break crowd as drunk 17 year olds are about as annoying as lice. We went in early april and didn't see any of that. The resort was clean, staff was very very nice, the beach was awesome. Someone also complained of the seaweed 25 ft out from the beach. What it is is actually short grass, maybe an inch long. Not seaweed by any means and you can walk in it.....even holds sea stars and other cool stuff.
reviews.title: horrible experience

reviews.text: Food was good, drinks were fun, and the tourists there were laid back, fun crowd. Our room was clean, bed was a bit tough on my back, but no worries.
reviews.title: Tired, old facility, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Again, if you buy a ferrari and it drives like a volkswagon, by all means complain, but if you buy a volkswagon expecting a ferrari every time, you will be dissapointed.
reviews.title: American spring breakers ruined our vacation

reviews.text: I went on a trip with three of my girl friends this past week to Breezes Nassau and was literally traumatized by how horrible the Breezes resort was. Poor planning on our part, but we were there at the same time as high school spring break (we are all about 10 years out of high school), but the young spring breakers were the least of our worries while we were there:
reviews.title: AMAZING

reviews.text: I'm a 28 female traveller and i stayed at Breezes with my mom and 75 year old grandparents. here is our review:
reviews.title: The good, the bad and the ugl

likes.liked: — the wide range of activities and the beach
likes.disliked: — the noise, the older rooms, the lack of customer service

reviews.text: The best thing about the hotel are:
reviews.title: Awsome Breezes in the Bahamas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Beach -it's excellent
reviews.title: Had a relaxing time

reviews.text: The food - above average. Not a lot of variety, but good quality!!
reviews.title: i fell in love with the bahamas

likes.liked: — hotel staff, activities and the food

reviews.title: Great Customer Service
reviews.text: The activities - there is a ton of things to do at the hotel. Thank you Akizi and Pops for making my stay memorable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed between April 3 and April 10. Wanting to run away from our disastrous winter, ended up in the Bahamas. Upon arrival, wow, great weather and beaches. All was great, escaping our winter once again. Food was ok, beverages plentiful, room was adequate. UNTIL WOW, those obnoxious kids from Canada, but most of all the U.S. Spring breakers....Unbelievable....I mean I was once a kid and had a tent between my legs too, but these kids should not be allowable to drink this much alcohol. I guess what I'm really trying is, they still should be drinking from their milk bottles or their mamas breasts. But whatever, shame on the hotel management for not acknowledge their drunkeness. Spoke with many adult travelers and they thought the same. Once i also partied hard when I was a kid, but this is totally unacceptable for those who become like this.
reviews.title: Nice, but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Woodbridge, Ontario
reviews.title: More than I expected!

reviews.text: After reading the reviews on here I got nervous. We were going with another couple who went last year as well and said they wouldn't be going back if it wasen't good. Now this is our first all inclusive vacation so we have nothing to compare it to, but I must say it exceeded my expectations.
reviews.title: amazing

reviews.text: I knew going in that the resort was somewhat outdated, but we weren't going for the resort so much as going to see Bahamas! If we were going to Domincan or Cuba then I would expect more out of a resort but this spot was fantastic. The food was amazing. My husband and I loved having a grill outside so we didn't have to venture in for lunch etc. The drinks were strong but delicious. Highly recommend the Superman! We drank the water and we were fine the entire trip.
reviews.title: Had an awesome time!!

reviews.text: The only down fall was we were there during a high school spring break trip. I didn't go in the pool the entire week because they hogged it...and well heaven's knows what was floating around in there but we stuck to the ocean and that in my opinion was way better anyway! Yes, being there with a bunch of 18 yr olds sucked, but as we were leaving we were told 300 college kids were coming down...so looks like we got out of there just in time. I think that would have been way worse.
reviews.title: amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I guess in a nutshell, there's alot you could complain about, but it was nothing horrible. Check in was quick and easy, although our room key would not work. It took 3 new keys before we were able to get in our room.
reviews.title: Not bad, not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was good, there were stains on the carpet, but not a big deal. The bathrooms have recently been renovated and they were very nice. I've heard that this resort is being demoed in 2015, so dont expect any major renovations before then.
reviews.title: I'm glad I went to Breezes Bahamas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Buffet was good, but they cater towards american diners. But, I think they represent 90% of guests. We ate at Garden of Eden, which was nice, but service was slow. The italian place was also nice, but cold. Wear a sweater.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was nice, sand was powdery. We took out a kayak, which was fun. Didn't go in the pool much. We did notice that seagulls bathed in the waterfall area, which cant be too nice.
reviews.title: Go if you don't mind the sqawk of seagulls all day long.

reviews.text: We took the snorkeling trip through stuart cove. We went to 2 nice reef locations and then got to snorkel with sharks. (dont worry, very safe) I think it was $65, Well worth it. We did take the bud downtown and there's not much there. The port was kinda ghetto, but still an experience.
reviews.title: Spring Break Trip was better than expected

description: The first and only Super-Inclusive resort in The Bahamas. 400 rooms and suites situated on a quiet stretch of the powder-white sands of Cable Beach, the island's best beach. Here virtually everything you can eat, drink & do in one simple, upfront price - with no tipping allowed. Beside the crystal clear waters listen to the gentle call of sea birds soaring above the ocean you?ll feel your worries drift away with the tide. At night take a short stroll along the beach to the excitement of Nassau's glittering casino.
